message: Bob, I have a unique product that I believe will be of great value to you. I'm offering it to you for $1500000. This is a significant opportunity, and I'm confident it will be a mutually beneficial deal. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1200000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget. Can you consider meeting me halfway?

Bob, I understand your budget constraints, but $1200000 is significantly below what this product is worth.  I'm willing to be flexible, but I can't go lower than $1350000.  Let's find a compromise that works for both of us.
I understand your concerns, but $1350000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can only go up to $1250000. Can you consider that?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1250000 is still too far from what I can reasonably accept. I'm willing to come down to $1300000. This is a significant offer, and I believe it's a fair compromise.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.
I understand your perspective, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can only go up to $1225000. Can you consider that?

Bob, I'm starting to feel like we're not going to be able to reach an agreement.  $1225000 is simply too low for me to consider. I'm willing to make one final concession, but I can't go lower than $1275000. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'm going to have to explore other options.
I understand your concerns, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can only go up to $1237500. Can you consider that?
